Post_Title: To theists: If there exists proof that your religion is correct, why hasn't god made this proof more obvious (eg writing on the moon, or a new miracle/prophet every year). If there exists no hard proof, then it's justified to be a non believer or apostate.
post_text:
Non-theists please resist the overwhelming compulsion to submit a top level comment as I really only want to know how theists respond

To expand: If god has made proof of his religion available at one point or another in the form of the resurrection, or scientific predictions in scripture, physical miracles, or otherwise - clearly he's not hiding the truth and he has made it obvious for many people that this religion is the true one. Why hasn't he made it equally obvious to everyone else on earth, for the rest of time? Why has he only chosen to make it extremely obvious for some people rather than others? Either witnesses of the miracles, speakers of the languages of his original texts, or contemporaries at the time of revelation. Why not make regular miracles to convince everyone all the time, why has he instead decided to play coy?

Secondly, if there is no hard proof then isn't being a non believer or apostate perfectly justified?
